question.title: Creating gradle plugin using maven
question.body:
Little backstory:

I have project built using maven. As part of this project I have maven plugin. Now I want to use that plugin from another project built by gradle. Unfortunately it is impossible to use maven plugins from gradle directly. So as a solution I want to create gradle plugin with same functionality in my first project.

My actual question

How can I build gradle plugin using maven?

Where gradle looks for plugins? Will it be enough to publish it in maven repository or I need to publish it somewhere else?

I don't want to create gradle project just for this plugin if I can avoid it.

answers.body:
You can create/produce a Gradle plugin while using Maven as your main build tool. You could technically avoid the additional Gradle build, but you would need to essentially replicate what Gradle does for you. At a high level:

  • Generate the plugin descriptor in the jar file's META-INF directory.
  • Create/publish a Plugin Marker Artifacts for each produced plugin
  • Create/publish the plugin JAR itself.

But all of this is done for you automatically with Gradle. So you can have an dedicated Gradle project that produces the plugin and all associated/required artifacts, but delegate the building to Maven. This is exactly what the Spring Boot team did prior to moving their entire build to Gradle.

You can see the entire setup here: https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/tree/2.2.x/spring-boot-project/spring-boot-tools/spring-boot-gradle-plugin

Inspecting the pom.xml, you'll see the usage of exec-maven-plugin and others to execute the Gradle build with Maven.

question_comments.body: @aled I already know that I can't use existing maven plugin from gradle. I mentioned that in my question. I'm asking how to create new gradle plugin, but build it using maven.

This question is similar to: Can I use a Maven plugin (enunciate) in Gradle?. If you believe it’s different, please edit the question, make it clear how it’s different and/or how the answers on that question are not helpful for your problem.
